class  OppDispatcher
 Internal dispatcher for OBEX messages related to OPP.

Detailed Description

Base class for OPP clients within applications.

The present class offers an interface to run OPP (Object Push Pull) over OBEX. All instances of this interface share the common internal implementation class ObexClientOppImpl which contains the protocol automaton. Multiple instances of this interface can be used simultaneously by the application layer, but operations will be queued and processed in a serial manner since the implementation supports only one OBEX connection.

When only a PUSH service is required, it is much more comfortable to use the front-end class ObexOppBinDataPushClient as this will spare application SW the tedious job of data buffer management and segmentation.

Default constructor.

Default-constructed instances must be initialized using Init() before using them the first time.

Member Function Documentation

ObexResult ObexOppClient::Abort (  const WString &  desc,
BOOLEAN  force_sync = FALSE
) 
 

Aborts a pending PUSH or PULL operation.

After the pending operation has been aborted, either OnPullComplete() or OnPushComplete() are invoked with an ObexResult indication that the operation was aborted. A different behaviour can be achieved by setting 'force_sync' to 'TRUE', this will terminate any pending operation synchronously from the API point of view. This behaviour might be useful when sudden application shutdown must be dealt with.

Parameters:
desc Textual description of the abort cause.
force_sync Force synchronous ABORT, this means that on return from the call any BinData instance is no longer referenced and can be destroyed and OnPushComplete() will NOT be invoked.

Reimplemented in ObexOppBinDataPushClient.

ObexResult ObexOppClient::Close (   ) 
 

Release a logical connection to a remote server.

ObexResult ObexOppClient::DataProcessed (  ObexBuffer &  app_data  ) 
 

Acknowledges processing of a received PULL data buffer.

Parameters:
app_data ObexBuffer which was passed by OnDataAvailable(). This call invalidates the buffer which must not be accessed by the application afterwards.

UINT32 ObexOppClient::GetProgressInBytes (   )  const
 

Returns the cumulative progress in transferring data.

This method returns the amount of data already transferred for a pending PUSH (outbound data) or PULL (inbound data) operation. The final value is preserved even beyond completion of that operation, hence it is reset to '0' when a new operation is initiated.

void ObexOppClient::Init (  Application *  app_ptr  )  [virtual]
 

Initializes a default-constructed object.

Parameters:
app_ptr Application pointer of the application which provides the context for the client. You may pass '0' as actual parameter to specify the currently active application.

void ObexOppClient::OnDataAvailable (  ObexBuffer &  app_data,
BOOLEAN  end_data
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Delivers the next chunk of data to the application.

Invoked within a PULL operation to indicate that another chunk of data is available for the application. After processing, the app must call DataProcessed() on the buffer.

Parameters:
app_data Buffer which holds the data pulled from the remote server.
end_data Tells wether this is the last chunk of data delivered by the remote server. Useful in case the object size is initially unknown.

void ObexOppClient::OnDataProcessed (  ObexBuffer &  app_data  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Confirms data transmission by APOXI OBEX.

Returns ownership of the buffer back to the application.

Parameters:
app_data ObexBuffer which was passed to APOXI OBEX via invoking Push() or ProvideData().

void ObexOppClient::OnPullComplete (  ObexResult  result,
ObexObject::ResponseCode  resp_code,
const WString &  pull_desc
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Indicates completion of a PULL operation.

Parameters:
result Either indicates success or carries an error code, for example loss of the transport connection.
resp_code Contains the OBEX response code returned by the remote server.
pull_desc Contains a textual description if one was returned by the remote server.

void ObexOppClient::OnPullConfirmed (  const WString &  obj_name,
const WString &  obj_desc,
UINT32  obj_size
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Confirms PULL and tells about the object being pulled.

The remote server has begun to process a PULL operation and is now delivering data.

Parameters:
obj_name OBEX object name.
obj_desc Description of the object to be pushed.
obj_size Total size of the whole object to be pushed. '0' indicates that the total object size is unknown.

void ObexOppClient::OnPushComplete (  ObexResult  result,
ObexObject::ResponseCode  resp_code,
const WString &  push_desc
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Indicates completion of a PUSH operation.

Parameters:
result Either indicates success or carries an error code.
resp_code Contains the OBEX response code returned by the remote server.
push_desc Contains the description if one was returned by the remote server.

Reimplemented in ObexOppBinDataPushClient.

void ObexOppClient::OnPushConfirmed (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Confirms that the remote server has accepted a PUSH.

The remote server has begun to process a PUSH operation and is now waiting for data.

ObexResult ObexOppClient::Open (  const String &  obex_url  ) 
 

Establish a logical connection to a remote server.

When more than one object is going to be pushed to or pulled from the same device open should be called specifying the URL of the remote service. Multiple consecutive push and/or pull operations can then be initiated without having to select a transport and device for each of the objects. After successful completion of the last operation please don't forget to call Close().

Parameters:
obex_url URL of the OBEX transport to use.

ObexResult ObexOppClient::ProvideData (  ObexBuffer &  app_data,
BOOLEAN  end_data = FALSE
) 
 

Submit data to be transferred within a PUSH operation.

Parameters:
app_data Buffer which holds the data to be pushed.
end_data Indicates that this is the last data chunk to be pushed within this operation. Only required when 'obj_size' was set to '0' in the first call to Push().

ObexResult ObexOppClient::Pull (  const String &  obex_url,
MimeType  obj_type = c_mime_unknown,
const WString &  obj_name = L""
) 
 

Starts pulling an object from a remote OPP server.

Parameters:
obex_url URL of the OBEX transport to use.
obj_type Mime type of the object to be pulled.
obj_name OBEX object name of the object to be pulled.

ObexResult ObexOppClient::Push (  const String &  obex_url,
const WString &  obj_name,
MimeType  obj_type,
const WString &  obj_desc,
UINT32  obj_size
) 
 

Starts pushing an object towards a remote OPP server.

Parameters:
obex_url URL of the OBEX transport to use.
obj_name OBEX object name.
obj_type Mime type of the object to be pushed.
obj_desc Description of the object to be pushed.
obj_size Total size of the whole object to be pushed. When the size is unknown, it should be set to '0'.
